section.title: Introduction
section.para: The Spring Social Intuit project is an extension to Spring Social that enables integration with Intuit Quickbooks.
Intuit Quickbooks is accounting software developed and marketed by Intuit.

Spring Social Intuit enables integration with Intuit Quickbooks with IntuitConnectionFactory, a connection factory that can be plugged into Spring Social's service provider connection framework, and with an API binding to Intuit's REST API.

section.title: How to get
section.para: Currently the only way to obtain this depenedency is to build and deploy to you local maven repository.

As an extension to Spring Social, Spring Social Intuit depends on Spring Social. Spring Social's core module will be transitively resolved from the Spring Social Intuit dependency. If you'll be using Spring Social's web module, you'll need to add that dependency yourself:
Note that Spring Social Intuit will release on a different schedule than Spring Social. Consequently, Spring Social's version may differ from that of Spring Social Intuit.
Consult Spring Social's reference documentation for more information on Spring Social dependencies.
